title: University of Virginia reaches deal with Trump administration over probes
shortDescription: The University of Virginia has reached an agreement with the Trump administration to adhere to guidance from the White House on admissions and hiring.

title: Sen. Merkley delivers over 22-hour Senate speech
shortDescription: Sen. Jeff Merkley, D-Oregon, held the Senate floor for roughly 22 hours to protest the Trump administration amid the government shutdown.

title: Republicans are beefing with Trump. Over beef.
shortDescription: President Donald Trump wants to import meat from Argentina to lower beef prices. Republicans from rural states aren't happy about it.

title: Two geniuses and an East Wing demolition: Trump's ballroom controversy
shortDescription: As pictures of the White House demolition began circulating, critics expressed outrage as the nationâ€™s preeminent historical structure stood gutted.

title: White House East Wing to be entirely gutted in a stark reversal
shortDescription: When the White House first released the plans for the ballroom, President Donald Trump told reporters it would not be 'touching' any building

title: Ingrassia among dozens of pulled Trump nominees, some over controversy
shortDescription: Paul Ingrassia withdrew himself from the running to lead a government agency after running up against controversy. He's not the first.

title: Jasmine Crockett for US Senate? Congresswoman teases run
shortDescription: The Texas congresswoman, who represents an urban Dallas district, is known for her testy exchanges with Republicans. Now, she might run for Senate.

title: See all of Trump's changes to the White House amid East Wing work
shortDescription: President Donald Trump has brought significant changes to the White House in 2025. See photos.

title: 'It's not his house': Politicians react to White House demolition
shortDescription: Some politicians have expressed frustration over the White House demolition as the federal government shutdown continues.

title: Maine Democratic Senate candidate covers tattoo resembling Nazi symbol
shortDescription: Democratic Maine Senate candidate Graham Platner said he covered up a tattoo resembling a Nazi symbol that he got nearly 20 years ago.

title: What is the East Wing of the White House? Demolitions underway
shortDescription: The East Wing first began as a terrace that existed during President Thomas Jefferson's administration.

title: Trump's golden White House makeover
shortDescription: Trump's $250 million, 90,000 square foot addition is one of the biggest changes in decades to the building that has housed U.S. presidents since 1800.

title: Trump reportedly suing DOJ, asking $230 million. Is he still a felon?
shortDescription: President Donald Trump sued the Department of Justice, asking for $230 million from legal troubles before second term. How many felonies does he have?

title: Americans break with Trump on Palestinian state: new approval poll
shortDescription: The president's approval sees a small jump in new Reuters/Ipsos poll but finds major break with Americans over the support of a Palestinian state.

title: Jeff Merkley protests Trump in 22-hour floor speech, setting state record
shortDescription: Oregon's Jeff Merkley spoke on the Senate floor all night long and into the evening on Oct. 22 to protest the Trump administration.

title: Driver arrested after striking White House security barrier: Officials
shortDescription: A man was arrested after he allegedly rammed his car into a security checkpoint outside the White House, officials said.

title: See the White House forever changed by these major overhauls
shortDescription: The White House has undergone major renovations since it's construction in 1792.The biggest was between 1948-1952 when it was completely gutted.

title: Federal government shutdown latest as Senate plans to vote12th time
shortDescription: The president turned down a meeting with Democratic leadership until the government reopens as the shutdown continues for the 22nd day.

title: Trump pick for whistleblower office withdraws after racist texts report
shortDescription: Paul Ingrassia said he is withdrawing "because unfortunately I do not have enough Republican votes at this time."

title: Trump's meeting with Putin in Budapest canceled
shortDescription: President Trump initially made plans for a meeting with Putin to work on an agreement to end the war with Ukraine. The summit was canceled days later.
